intro: Thyrsanthus multinervius, commonly known as the narrow-veined thyrsothamnus, is a shrub native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Proteaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage with prominent venation. The plant features small, clustered white flowers that bloom in spring, attracting native pollinators. Its leaves are narrow and leathery, adapted to the dry conditions of its natural habitat. Thyrsanthus multinervius is often found in coastal and inland forest margins, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
